name: Rowing, Seated
how_to_perform:
1. Sit on a chair or bench with your feet flat on the floor and hold onto the edge of the seat with both hands.

2. Keeping your core engaged, straighten your back and lift your chest to form a long line from head to heels. Keep your shoulders relaxed.

3. Pull one end of the rowing bar (or towel) towards you as if trying to grab it with your hands, keeping your elbows close to your body throughout the movement.

4. Focus on using your muscles in your back to pull the bar towards your chest, keeping your shoulders down and relaxed.

5. Slowly allow the bar to return back to its original position without bouncing or swinging it back out.

6. Repeat on the other side by pulling the bar in the opposite direction with your hands.

7. Continue rowing across from one end of you to the other for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Rowing involves using your arms and core muscles to pull a weight or bar, simulating the motion of rowing while seated.
